BattleUnitKind.level:
Sets the targets level
Star Point value is enemy Level minus Mario's level multiplied by a value that changes depending on how many enemies exist at the start of battle
0.5X for 1-2 enemies, 0.55x for 3 enemies, 0.65x for 4 enemies, and 0.75x for 5 enemies
Note that new enemies spawned mid-battle always use the 0.5x multiplier
BattleUnitKind.bonusXP:
Flat increase to Star Points gained
This amount is added after all calculations are done from the levels
Bonus XP is not given if Mario has a higher level than the enemy
BattleUnitKind.bonusCoin: Amount of extra coins you can earn from an enemy
BattleUnitKind.bonusCoinRate: The chance of gaining the Bonus Coins, the probability is rolled for each Bonus Coin
BattleUnitKind.baseCoin: The base amount of coins dropped from an enemy
BattleUnitKind.runRate: What % of the Run Meter is filled when starting to run, the meters starting position is the average of all enemies Run rate
BattleUnitKind.pbCap: The maximum number of Power Bounce hits you can land in a single attack
BattleUnitKind.swallowChance: Yoshi's chance to swallow the target, 255 = Disabled
BattleUnitKind.swallowAttribute:
None - Swallow with no knockback
Swallow Bomb - Unused, happens when gulping an ignited Bob-Omb, extra Animation Only
Spit Into Other Enemy - Gulp that spits into the next enemy
Spit Fireball - Unused, Gulps and spits fireballs if used on a fiery target
Swallow Part Of Enemy - Unused, only works on Pokey, swallows parts/head
BattleUnitKind.ultraHammerKnockChance: The chance of Super/Ultra hammer causing Knockback
BattleUnitKind.itemStealParameter: What % of the meter on Kiss Thief is a successful action command, 100 = Full Bar
BattleUnitKind.MapObj: Sets actors target position to 300 units back, this has an in-game effect of making that target no longer frontmost if other enemies are in the battle
BattleUnitKind.OutOfReach: Makes the target out of reach, seems to be used when target is on the ceiling
BattleUnitKind.Unquakeable: Makes the target immune to Quake
BattleUnitKind.IsInvisible: Makes the target invisible, seems to just be the invisible status
BattleUnitKind.IsVeiled: Makes the target act as if they are veiled, if set on an enemy they will be veiled at the start of battle and never be able to be hit
BattleUnitKind.ShellShielded: Makes the target act as if they are Shell Shielded, does nothing if target does not have a Shell Shield
BattleUnitKind.NeverTargetable: Makes the target untargetable with any attacks
BattleUnitKind.DisableZeroGravityFloat: Disables the floating effect from the unused zero gravity battle effect
BattleUnitKind.DisableZeroGravityImmobility: Disables the immobility caused  from the unused zero gravity battle effect
BattleUnitKind.immuneToUltraHammerKnock: Makes the target immune to knockback from Super/Ultra Hammer
BattleUnitKind.IsUndead: When enabled, stops the target from dying when they reach 0HP
BattleUnitKind.IsCorpse: This flag is used when any of the Dry Bones variants are in their downed state
BattleUnitKind.IsLeader:
Designates target as a leader
All leaders must be defeated on Mario's side for a game over to occur
This flag seems to have no effect on enemies
BattleUnitKind.CannotTakeActions: When enabled on a target it prevents them from taking any actions
BattleUnitKind.NotSpunByLoveSlap: When set, the target is immune to the visual effect of the Love Slap damage patterns
BattleUnitKind.DisableDamageStars: When set, the target does not display the damage stars and number when taking damage
BattleUnitKind.DisableAllPartVisibility: When enabled, this flag disables the visibility of all parts relating to the target
BattleUnitKind.DisableHPGauge: Disables the HP Gauge in battle
BattleUnitKind.NoShadow: Disables the visibility of the targets shadow
BattleUnitKind.DisableDamage:
This flag sets the target to be immune to taking damage
Does not prevent damage numbers from appearing, but health will not lower

BattleUnitKindPart.NotBombableBodyPart: When this flag is enabled the part becomes immune to any attack with the flag OnlyTargetSelectParts
BattleUnitKindPart.InHole: Sets the target to always be frontmost, this seems to cause most if not all attacks to miss
BattleUnitKindPart.WeakToAttackFxR:
Determines if target has a weakness to Attack FXR
Doesn't work when enabled on enemies
If disabled on Hooktail her attack still drops, just not her defense
When enabled on Hooktail it can pierce up to 2 defense, whether its Base Defense or Status Defense
BattleUnitKindPart.WeakToIcePower: Determines if target is weak to Ice Power, target takes +1 damage.
BattleUnitKindPart.IsWinged:
Decides if an target has wings
Does nothing if enabled on a normal enemy
If disabled on a winged target then said target will not drop/lose wings when hit.
BattleUnitKindPart.IsShelled:
Determines if an target has a shell
Does nothing if enabled on a normal enemy
If disabled on a shelled target then said target will not flip when jumped on.
BattleUnitKindPart.IsBombFlippable:
Decides if an target is flipped by Bomb attacks
Does nothing when enabled on a normal enemy, unless said target is normally flippable
If disabled on a bomb flippable target then said target will not flip when hit with a Bomb attack.
BattleUnitKindPart.IsClonelike: Makes an enemy clonelike, similar to a Wizzerd/Magikoopa clone
BattleUnitKindPart.DisableFlatPaperLayering:
When enabled, makes an invisible target appear strangely, the model is no longer flattened
Enabling on an target that has it disabled by default changes nothing about the invisible status
This flag also makes the Dodgy idle animation not play, however the Dodgy dodge animation still plays
BattleUnitKindPart.NeverTargetable: This flag prevents the target from being targeted
BattleUnitKindPart.IgnoreMapObjectOffset: This flag ignores the offset from Is Map Object
BattleUnitKindPart.IgnoreOnlyTargetSelectAndPreferredParts: This flag gives the target immunity to OnlyTargetSelectParts and OnlyTargetPreferredParts
BattleUnitKindPart.Untattleable: The target can not be tattled
BattleUnitKindPart.JumplikeCannotTarget: Jump attacks and other similar attacks cannot target the target
BattleUnitKindPart.HammerlikeCannotTarget: Hammer attacks and other similar attacks cannot target the target
BattleUnitKindPart.ShellTosslikeCannotTarget: Shell Toss and other similar attacks cannot target the target
BattleUnitKindPart.PreventHealthDecrease:
This flag sets the target to be immune to taking damage
Does not prevent damage numbers from appearing, but health will not lower
BattleUnitKindPart.DisablePartVisibility: When enabled, this flag disables the visibility of the model the Part Struct is related to
BattleUnitKindPart.ImmuneToCustom:
This flag prevents attacks with the flag CustomAttackType from targeting the target
This flag functions on Mario/Partner and enemies
This flag has a side effect of disabling some animations and shadows
BattleUnitKindPart.Independence: Seems to be used on certain parts to handle moving objects
BattleUnitKindPart.IsImmuneToDamageOrStatus: Target cannot be inflicted with statuses or take damage from attacks, superguards can still damage the target
BattleUnitKindPart.IsImmuneToOHKO: Target cannot be defeated by the OHKO status
BattleUnitKindPart.IsImmuneToStatus: The target can not be inflicted with any status
BattleUnitKindPart.TopSpiky: Sets the target to be top spiky
BattleUnitKindPart.PreemptiveFrontSpiky:
Sets the target to be front spiky and interrupt attacks that walk up to it
Only Bristle has this effect in vanilla
BattleUnitKindPart.FrontSpiky: Sets the target to be front spiky
BattleUnitKindPart.Fiery:
Sets the target to be fiery on contact
User takes 1 damage on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
BattleUnitKindPart.FieryStatus:
Sets the target to inflict burn on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
BattleUnitKindPart.Icy:
Sets the target to be icy on contact
User takes 1 damage on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
BattleUnitKindPart.IcyStatus:
Sets the target to inflict freeze on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
BattleUnitKindPart.Poison:
Sets the target to be poisonous on contact
User takes 1 damage on contact
Target also receives damage
BattleUnitKindPart.PoisonStatus:
Sets the target to inflict poison on contact
Target also receives damage
BattleUnitKindPart.Electric:
Sets the target to be electric on contact
User takes 1 damage on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
BattleUnitKindPart.ElectricStatus:
Sets the target to inflict electric on contact
User takes 1 damage on contact
No damage is dealt to the target
Once user has electric status they can make contact with the target
BattleUnitKindPart.Explosive:
Sets the target to be explosive
Fire and Explosive attacks will cause target to be defeated instantly
BattleUnitKindPart.VolatileExplosive:
Sets the target to be Volatile Explosive, any form of contact/damage/item used on the target will cause said target to be immediately defeated
If contact is made user takes 1 damage

HealthUpgrades.upgradeHP: Sets how much to upgrade HP by per level
HealthUpgrades.upgradeFP: Sets how much to upgrade FP by per level
HealthUpgrades.upgradeBP: Sets how much to upgrade BP by per level

BattleUnitDefense.fire: Sets targets defense to fire attacks
BattleUnitDefense.ice: Sets targets defense to icy attacks
BattleUnitDefense.explosion: Sets targets defense to explosive attacks
BattleUnitDefense.electric: Sets targets defense to electric attacks

BattleUnitDefenseAttr.normal:
Sets what happens when a target is hit by a normal attack
No Effect - Nothing unique happens when the target is hit
Weak To - Target is weak to this attribute, target takes +1 damage from hits
Immune To - Target cannot be damaged with this attribute
Absorbs - When hit with this attribute the target takes no damage and heals based on the attacks damage
Immune To (Except Gulp) - This target is immune to this attribute type, unless the attack is Gulp, Iron Clefts use this in vanilla
BattleUnitDefenseAttr.fire:
Sets what happens when a target is hit by a fire attack
No Effect - Nothing unique happens when the target is hit
Weak To - Target is weak to this attribute, target takes +1 damage from hits
Immune To - Target cannot be damaged with this attribute
Absorbs - When hit with this attribute the target takes no damage and heals based on the attacks damage
Immune To (Except Gulp) - This target is immune to this attribute type, unless the attack is Gulp, Iron Clefts use this in vanilla
BattleUnitDefenseAttr.ice:
Sets what happens when a target is hit by a ice attack
No Effect - Nothing unique happens when the target is hit
Weak To - Target is weak to this attribute, target takes +1 damage from hits
Immune To - Target cannot be damaged with this attribute
Absorbs - When hit with this attribute the target takes no damage and heals based on the attacks damage
Immune To (Except Gulp) - This target is immune to this attribute type, unless the attack is Gulp, Iron Clefts use this in vanilla
BattleUnitDefenseAttr.explosion:
Sets what happens when a target is hit by a explosive attack
No Effect - Nothing unique happens when the target is hit
Weak To - Target is weak to this attribute, target takes +1 damage from hits
Immune To - Target cannot be damaged with this attribute
Absorbs - When hit with this attribute the target takes no damage and heals based on the attacks damage
Immune To (Except Gulp) - This target is immune to this attribute type, unless the attack is Gulp, Iron Clefts use this in vanilla
BattleUnitDefenseAttr.electric:
Sets what happens when a target is hit by a electric attack
No Effect - Nothing unique happens when the target is hit
Weak To - Target is weak to this attribute, target takes +1 damage from hits
Immune To - Target cannot be damaged with this attribute
Absorbs - When hit with this attribute the target takes no damage and heals based on the attacks damage
Immune To (Except Gulp) - This target is immune to this attribute type, unless the attack is Gulp, Iron Clefts use this in vanilla

StatusVulnerability.sleep: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Sleep. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.stop: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Stop. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.dizzy: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Dizzy. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.poison: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Poison. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.confuse: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Confusion. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.electric: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Electrified. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.burn: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Burn. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.freeze: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Freeze. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.huge: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Huge. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.tiny: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Tiny. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.attack_up: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Attack Up. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.attack_down: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Attack Down. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.defense_up: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Defense Up. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.defense_down: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Defense Down. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.allergic: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Allergic. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.fright: Sets the probability that the target will be Frightened. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.gale_force: Sets the probability that the target will be Blown Away. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.fast: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Fast. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.slow: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Slow. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.dodgy: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Dodgy. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.invisible: Sets the probability that the target can be inflicted with Invisibility. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)
StatusVulnerability.ohko: Sets the probability that the target will be OHKO'd. Final status probability is (Susceptibility * Attack Status Chance)

BattleWeapon.accuracy:
Probability the attack will hit
Can be set above 100% to reduce effects of dizzy/dodgy
BattleWeapon.fp_cost:
The amount of FP needed to use an attack
This does nothing when set on an enemy
BattleWeapon.sp_cost:
The amount of SP Orbs an attack costs to use
This does work when set on an enemy attack, it will drain Mario's SP
BattleWeapon.superguard_state:
Sets how a superguard will impact the target
Unsuperguardable - This attack can not be superguarded
Superguardable with Recoil - This attack can be superguarded and the enemy will take 1 damage
Superguardable without Recoil - This attack can be superguarded but the enemy will not take damage
BattleWeapon.sylish_multiplier:
Impacts the amount of Star Power and Audience gained when using a stylish
0 Will yield very little
Has no impact on an attack if the stylish is not performed
Can not be disabled with -1/255
BattleWeapon.bingo_slot_inc_chance:
Sets the chance that the attack will add a Bingo Slot
0 Disables
Doesn't work with enemy attacks
BattleWeapon.base_damage_fn:
None - When set this function makes the attack do no damage, no parameters will do anything, badges that increase power will also have no effect
Get Jump Power - This function makes the attack scale with jump power, as you upgrade your boots this attack will grow stronger
Get Hammer Power - This function makes the attack scale with hammer power, as you upgrade your hammer this attack will grow stronger
Get Default Power - This function makes the attack call damage parameter 1 for damage, regardless of an action command success/fail
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - This function makes the attack scale with jump power, also enables badge damage scaling with parameters 7 and 8
Get Tornado Power - This function makes the attack damage behave like the Tornado Jump Tornadoes, does not actually add tornadoes to an attack, damage scaling badges still increase damage
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - This function makes the attack scale with hammer power, also enables badge damage scaling with parameters 7 and 8
Get Art Attack Power - This function makes the attack damage behave like Art Attack, since Art Attack is handled by its script this function behaves similar to "None" on all other attacks
Get Supernova Power - This function makes the attack damage behave like Supernova, since Supernova is handled by its script this function behaves similar to "Get Default Power" on all other attacks
Get Earth Tremor Power - This function makes the attack damage behave like Earth Tremor, since Earth Tremor is handled by its script this function makes all other attacks do 1 damage regardless of what damage parameters are set
Get Poison Shroom Power - This function makes the attack damage behave like Poison Shroom (Bingo), an attack with this flag will deal half of the targets HP, subtracting defense if applicable
Get Partner Power - This function makes the attack scale in power based on partner rank, since this requires checking the rank of a partner it seems to make all other attacks do 1 damage regardless of what damage parameters are set
Get Partner Action Command Power - This function makes the attack check for action command success when using an attack, used in a lot of attacks that have multiple success and fail states
BattleWeapon.base_damage1:
Get Jump Power - Normal Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Hammer Power -Normal Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Default Power - Sets the attacks damage, regardless of an action command success/fail
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Normal Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Tornado Power - The base damage of the attack
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Normal Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Supernova Power - Sets the attacks damage, regardless of an action command success/fail
Get Partner Power - Base Rank Partner failed action command damage
Get Partner Action Command Power - Functions differently depending on the value and type of move
BattleWeapon.base_damage2:
Get Jump Power - Normal Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Hammer Power - Normal Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Normal Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Tornado Power - The amount of damage each extra copy of Tornado Jump adds to the attack
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Normal Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Partner Power - Base Rank Partner successful action command damage
Get Partner Action Command Power - Sets base damage for the attack
BattleWeapon.base_damage3:
Get Jump Power - Super Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Hammer Power - Super Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Super Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Super Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Partner Power - Super Rank Partner failed action command damage
BattleWeapon.base_damage4:
Get Jump Power - Super Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Hammer Power - Super Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Super Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Super Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Partner Power - Super Rank Partner successful action command damage
BattleWeapon.base_damage5:
Get Jump Power - Ultra Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Hammer Power - Ultra Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Ultra Boots damage with a failed action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Ultra Hammer damage with a failed action command damage
Get Partner Power - Ultra Rank Partner failed action command damage
BattleWeapon.base_damage6:
Get Jump Power - Ultra Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Hammer Power - Ultra Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Ultra Boots damage with a successful action command damage
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Ultra Hammer damage with a successful action command damage
Get Partner Power - Ultra Rank Partner successful action command damage
BattleWeapon.base_damage7:
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Badge ID for badge stacking damage, any badge ID works in this parameter and will scale damage based on parameter 8
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Badge ID for badge stacking damage, any badge ID works in this parameter and will scale damage based on parameter 8
BattleWeapon.base_damage8:
Get Badge Stacked Jump Power - Value for increase or decrease in damage from stacked badges, can be set to positive or negative
Get Badge Stacked Hammer Power - Value for increase or decrease in damage from stacked badges, can be set to positive or negative
BattleWeapon.base_fpdamage1: Amount of FP drained, this only functions on Flower Fuzzy in vanilla
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetMarioOrShellShield: Attack can not target Mario or a Shell Shield
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetPartner: Attack used can not target the partner character, works when set on Mario and enemies
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetEnemy: Attack used can not target an enemy, this seems to do nothing when set on an enemy
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetTreeOrSwitch: Seems to go unused, enabled on all attacks, disabling seems to change nothing
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetSystem:
Prevents the attack from targeting system units
Bomb Squad counts as a system unit, so if an attack has this flag disabled, said attack can target Bomb Squad bombs
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetOppositeAlliance: The attack used cannot target the side opposite of the user
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetOwnAlliance: The attack used cannot target the users own Alliance
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetSelf: The attack used cannot target the user
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetSameSpecies: The attack used cannot target the same type of target as the attacks user
BattleWeapon.OnlyTargetSelf: The attack used can only target the user
BattleWeapon.OnlyTargetMario: The attack used will only target Mario
BattleWeapon.OnlyTargetTreeOrSwitch: Makes the attack only able to target Tree or Switch
BattleWeapon.OnlyTargetPreferredParts:
Makes the selected attack only able to target certain parts
This flag seems to only matter in fights with enemies that have multiple parts
BattleWeapon.OnlyTargetSelectParts:
Makes the attack only able to target certain parts
Only used on Bomb Squad in vanilla, and seems to disable hitting multiple parts on bosses that have them
BattleWeapon.SingleTarget: Makes the attack only target a single target
BattleWeapon.MultipleTarget: Makes the attack target all enemies except for those immune due to other flags
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetAnything: Completely disables targeting options for the attack
BattleWeapon.Tattlelike: Makes the attack be considered tattle-like, meaning a target that can't be tattled can't be targeted by the attack
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetFloating2:
The attack will not be able to target a floating target
Only used on Fuzzy Horde in vanilla
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetCeiling: The attack will not be able to target an target on the ceiling
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetFloating: The attack will not be able to target a floating target
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetGrounded: The attack will not be able to target an target on the ground
BattleWeapon.Jumplike: Makes the attack Jump-like, meaning a target with Jump-like Attacks Cannot Target set can not be targeted by this attack
BattleWeapon.Hammerlike: Makes the attack Hammer-like, meaning a target with Hammer-like Attacks Cannot Target set can not be targeted by this attack
BattleWeapon.ShellTosslike: Makes the attack Shell Toss-like, meaning a target with Shell Toss-like Attacks Cannot Target set can not be targeted by this attack
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetGroundedVariant:
A broken version of Cannot Target Grounded
If an attack is Jump-like or has no attack likeness set, it cannot target grounded targets
If an attack is Shell Toss-like or Hammer-like it loses all targeting options
BattleWeapon.RecoilDamage:
Only enabled on Super Hammer 2, Ultra Hammer 2, and Gulp 5
Doesn't seem to do anything when enabled/disabled
BattleWeapon.CanOnlyTargetFrontmost: Makes the attack only able to target the frontmost target
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetShellShield: Disables targeting targets with a Shell Shield
BattleWeapon.CannotTargetCustom:
Gives the attack an Unused Attack Type property
This seems to do nothing unless the target has the Is Immune To Custom Type flag, in which case this attack can not target that entity
BattleWeapon.TargetSameAllianceDirection: Makes the attack target order follow the opposite direction the user is facing
BattleWeapon.TargetOppositeAllianceDirection: Makes the attack target order follow the direction the user is facing
BattleWeapon.element: Sets the attacks element: Normal, Fire, Ice, Explosive, or Electric
BattleWeapon.damage_pattern:
Decides what effects are on an attack, some are visual and some have functions
None - No effect
Gulp Knocked onto Ground 1 - Visual only, Gulp Knockback
Gulp Knocked onto Ground 2 - Visual only, buggy animations
Gulp Knocked into next Target - Does Gulp knockback
Remove Segment - This is set on most Shell moves, this property is what allows Shell moves to remove Pokey segments
Squashed - Visual, squishes at different lengths
Inked - Visual, Blooper Ink
Super Hammer Knocked Back - Does Super Hammer Knockback
Ultra Hammer Knocked Back - Incredibly buggy
Ultra Hammer Finisher - When enabled on an attack it will not play an FX sound if you have the FX badges equipped, also the damage woosh visual when an enemy takes damage is slightly bigger
Confusion Effect - Visual, confused effect
Love Slap Spin 1/2 - Visual, spin
Love Slap Quick Spin 1/2 - Visual, quick spin
Blown Away - Visual, blows enemy away (seems to only work on defeating hit)
Play Additional Ending Hurt Animation - Seems to be the finishing hit on some multi-hit attacks to ensure a 0HP target is defeated
BattleWeapon.ac_level:
Determines how difficult an action command is
Extremely Easy - 3 Simplifiers
Very Easy - 2 Simplifiers
Easy - 1 Simplifier
None - Base
Difficult - 1 Unsimplifier
Very Difficult - 2 Unsimplifiers
Extremely Difficult - 3 Unsimplifiers
BattleWeapon.BadgeCanAffectPower:
Determines if badges modify the power of the attack
This does not have any impact on stacking offensive badges when disabled
BattleWeapon.StatusCanAffectPower: Determines if statuses modify the power of the attack
BattleWeapon.IsChargeable: Determines if charge increases the power of the attack
BattleWeapon.CannotMiss:
The attack cannot miss
This setting ignores invisible, dodgy, and dizzy, lucky, and veil
BattleWeapon.DiminishingReturnsByHit: Damage decreases on your attack by 1 per hit, but never to 0
BattleWeapon.DiminishingReturnsByTarget: Damage decreases on your attack by 1 per target hit, but never to 0
BattleWeapon.PiercesDefense:
Makes the attack ignore all forms of defense, whether base, elemental, status, badges, and the defend action
Does not ignore P-Down D-Up or Guards
BattleWeapon.IgnoreTargetStatusVulnerability: Makes the attack ignore status vulnerabilities
BattleWeapon.IgnitesIfBurned: If the user is burned then the attack will be changed into the fire element
BattleWeapon.PlayActiveFXSound: Enables FX sounds based on which FX badges the user has on
BattleWeapon.FlipsShellEnemies:
Attack will flip the enemy if they are shelled
Does nothing if Is Shelled is set on an enemy without a shell
BattleWeapon.FlipsBombFlippableEnemies:
Attack will flip the enemy if they are normally Bomb-Flippable
Does nothing if Is Bomb-Flippable is set on an enemy without normally being Bomb-Flippable
BattleWeapon.GroundsWingedEnemies:
Attack will ground winged enemies
Does nothing if Is Winged is set on an enemy without wings
BattleWeapon.CanBeUsedAsConfusedAction: The attack can be called as a random confused attack with this flag set
BattleWeapon.Unguardable: The attack can not be guarded, this flag also disables superguarding
BattleWeapon.CanHitClonelike: Attack will be able to target and make contact with a clone enemy
BattleWeapon.PreferFront: Multiplies the weights by 0.5, 0.9, 1.3, etc. from back to front
BattleWeapon.PreferBack: Multiplies the weights by 0.5, 0.9, 1.3, etc. from front to back
BattleWeapon.PreferLessHealthy: Multiplies weights by (2.0 - target's current fraction of Max HP)
BattleWeapon.GreatlyPreferLessHealthy: Multiplies weights by (1.0 - target's current fraction of Max HP)
BattleWeapon.PreferLowerHP: Multiplies weights by (1.5 - target's current HP/20)
BattleWeapon.PreferHigherHP: Multiplies weights by (1.5 + target's current HP/20)
BattleWeapon.PreferInPeril: Multiplies weights of a target in Peril by 50%
BattleWeapon.ChooseWeightedRandomly: Picks from the final weights randomly
BattleWeapon.size_change_chance: Chance of inflicting a Size Change
BattleWeapon.size_change_time: Duration of an inflicted Size Change
BattleWeapon.size_change_strength: Strength of an Inflicted Size Change
BattleWeapon.atk_change_time: Duration of an inflicted Attack Change
BattleWeapon.atk_change_strength: Strength of an Inflicted Attack Change
BattleWeapon.def_change_time: Duration of an inflicted Defense Change
BattleWeapon.def_change_strength: Strength of an Inflicted Defense Change
BattleWeapon.attack_evt: Attack Scripts change what move is used when an attack is selected
BattleWeapon.stage_background_fallweight1: Probability of making small and large stage objects fall
BattleWeapon.stage_background_fallweight2: Probability of making large stage objects fall
BattleWeapon.stage_background_fallweight3: Probability of making small stage objects fall
BattleWeapon.stage_background_fallweight4: Probability of making the background wall fall
BattleWeapon.stage_nozzle_turn_chance: The probability that the nozzles on the stage change targets
BattleWeapon.stage_nozzle_fire_chance: The probability that the nozzles on the stage will fire
BattleWeapon.stage_ceiling_fall_chance: The chance the ceiling will fall
BattleWeapon.stage_object_fall_chance: Sets the probability that a stage prop will fall
